page.title: 13Hunton Village Shopkeeper
page.content: Our day starts at 5.45a.m. The first job is a family one, sorting out and delivering papers or magazines. We eat breakfast at 7a.m. A bread van arrives daily before the shop opens at eight. The first customers appear; men going to work, early women shoppers,children heading for school. On Tuesdays and Fridays I drive to Leyburn for confectionary, meat, pies and fresh baked bread. Each day I open the{POST OFFICE}at 9a.m. I deal with a steady stream of customers for child allowances, pensions etc. Twice weekly I deliver provisions around this and nearby villages. Being a village store we stock a wide range of goods. The day's Postal business has to be completed by 4.45. Shoppers are served up to 5.30. Then the shop closes and tidying up begins, plus my replacing stock and preparing next day's orders.
